1.q_string:
Match the following.

Modifications of roots Description
a. Tuberous roots 1. slender roots become suddenly swollen near the apex
b. Fasciculated roots 2. roots are swollen without any definite shape
c. Nodulose roots 3. several tubercular roots occur in a cluster at the base of the stem

Which of the following plants has/have large leaves that completely ensheath the inner portion of the bulb?

a. Allium

b. Lilium

c. Tulip

Which of the following is an example of a weak, slender, lateral branch arising from the base of shoot buried in the soil and grows horizontally outwards with adventitious roots given out where it touches the ground?
Which part of a seed contains the embryo plant?
What is the primary function of the seed coat?
Which type of seed contains two cotyledons?
What is the function of the endosperm in a seed?
Which part of a seed gives rise to the primary root?
In which type of seed is the endosperm completely absorbed by the developing embryo before seed maturity?
Which type of fruit develops from the fusion of ovaries of multiple flowers?
What is an example of an accessory fruit?
Which part of a flower develops into a fruit after fertilization?
What is the function of the hypocotyl in seed germination?
Which type of seed has only one cotyledon?
What is the structure in a seed that connects the embryo to the seed coat and serves as a conduit for nutrient transfer?
Which part of a seed develops into the shoot system of the seedling?
What is the term used to describe the arrangement of flowers on a floral axis?
In which type of inflorescence are the flowers arranged along a single unbranched axis?
Which type of inflorescence has the main axis terminated by a single flower?
What is the characteristic arrangement of flowers in a corymb inflorescence?
q_option: Flowers arranged in a cluster with the main axis elongated
Flowers arranged in a flat-topped cluster with the main axis shortened
Flowers arranged in a raceme with the main axis elongated
Flowers arranged in a head-like cluster with the main axis shortened

1.q_string: Which type of inflorescence has a main axis with several branches of nearly equal length?
In which type of inflorescence are the flowers arranged in a head-like cluster?
What is the characteristic arrangement of flowers in a spike inflorescence?
q_option: Flowers arranged in a cluster with the main axis elongated
Flowers arranged in a flat-topped cluster with the main axis shortened
Flowers arranged in a head-like cluster with the main axis shortened
Flowers arranged along an elongated unbranched axis

1.q_string: Which of the following is not a characteristic of a fruit?
q_option: Develops from the ovary of a flower

1.q_string: Which of the following best defines a true fruit?
q_option: A fruit formed from a single ovary of a single flower and may or may not include additional floral parts.
A fruit formed from multiple ovaries of a single flower.
A fruit formed from the fusion of multiple flowers.
A fruit formed from a single ovary of multiple flowers.

1.q_string: Which type of fruit develops from a single ovary of a flower?
What distinguishes an aggregate fruit from a simple fruit?
q_option: Develops from multiple ovaries of a single flower
Contains multiple seeds within a single ovary

1.q_string: What is the characteristic arrangement of flowers in an umbel inflorescence?
q_option: Flowers arranged in a raceme with the main axis elongated
Flowers arranged in a flat-topped cluster with the main axis shortened
Flowers arranged in a head-like cluster with the main axis shortened
Flowers arranged in a cluster with all flower stalks arising from a common point

1.q_string: Which type of inflorescence has a main axis terminated by a single flower and surrounded by smaller lateral flowers?
In which type of inflorescence are the flowers arranged along a single elongated unbranched axis with the oldest flowers at the base?
